Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory785.jpg'}
{3: 'The moon has fully sunk under the horizon, casting a muted silver glow in the distant sky.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Noan springs the firefly into life, placing it in his palm and letting its warm glow dispel the darkness before dawn.'}
{3: 'He lowers his head in silence for a moment before he slowly and softly speaks.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'I grew up in a very crammed space.', 4: '1', 18: '100002509'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Beds were packed together. The lucky few got a torn curtain around their beds, but most lived without a rag or a place to sleep.', 4: '1', 18: '100002510'}

{2: 'Noan', 3: 'When everyone was crammed into the same space... Everything happened before your eyes whether you wanted to see it or not—pride to be shown off, shame to be hidden...', 4: '1', 18: '100002511'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Love, sex, hatred, quarrel, theft, robbery, accidents, and murders...', 4: '1', 18: '100002512'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Mothers cried out loud, giving birth amidst the noise of the crowd, while the sick died moaning, ignored by all.', 4: '1', 18: '100002513'}
{3: 'Noan sighs.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "...Have you ever heard of the hedgehog's dilemma?", 4: '1', 18: '100002514'}

{2: 'Noan', 3: "Hedgehogs want to huddle together for warmth in winter, but their spines hurt each other if they get too close. Yet, if they're too far apart, they feel cold.", 4: '1', 18: '100002515'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Humans are no different. They need to keep an appropriate distance from others, not too far, yet not too close.', 4: '1', 18: '100002516'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'But in that place, everyone was packed tightly together. When there was no way to maintain proper distance, privacy no longer existed.', 4: '1', 18: '100002517'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'In such a situation, how could "hedgehogs" avoid hurting each other?', 4: '1', 18: '100002518'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "That's why those who arrived earlier always told me to seek common ground, to hide my own attitudes and goals.", 4: '1', 18: '100002519'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "In that environment, I learned not to bring up topics others didn't want to discuss and to ignore what they didn't want to be seen.", 4: '1', 18: '100002520'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "If someone only wants to talk about a certain subject, then I'll only discuss that with them.", 4: '1', 18: '100002521'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "If someone hides their wounds well, even if I have noticed, I should pretend I didn't see them.", 4: '1', 18: '100002522'}
{3: 'Noan looks earnestly at you as always. The glow from the firefly makes his amber pupils reflect a concealed emotion.'}

{2: 'Noan', 3: "A saint may be able to hold no desires or demands and endure everything. But I'm not a saint. I, too, have people and things I care about so much that I wouldn't take the smallest step back.", 4: '1', 18: '100002523'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'I just try not to show these emotions on my face—learned that lesson the hard way when I was a child.', 4: '1', 18: '100002524'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Now, I can speak these words only because you've shared so much with me...", 4: '1', 18: '100002525'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "...Exchanging and sharing, that's also a habit of traveling merchants, I guess.", 4: '1', 18: '100002526'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'You had something to say when you first saw me this morning, right?', 3: '36'}
{2: 'Can you tell me now?', 3: '38'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "It wasn't important. I just wanted to say...", 4: '1', 18: '100002528'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Your hair... seems to have grown a bit longer since the last time I saw you.', 4: '1', 18: '100002529'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'How have you been lately? Everything alright?', 4: '1', 18: '100002530'}
{2: 'Not bad.', 3: '43', 4: 'I have a lot to say to you too...', 5: '43'}
{3: 'Noan nods as he quietly observes you, waiting for the conversation to continue—just like he always does.'}
{3: 'And so, just like before, you slowly begin to recount recent events.'}
{3: 'Be it minor joys, reports you would rather avoid, the burden of social obligations, or investigations still without leads.'}
{3: 'Beyond the troubles, there are many small joys too, like receiving a long-awaited gift, or discovering a new dish at a favorite restaurant that turns out to be surprisingly delicious.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory782.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '0.2', 5: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'By the time you have told all that could be said, the sky has revealed the first hints of dawn.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'He listens attentively to every word, showing great empathy. When you say something glad, his face lights up; when you mention something depressing, he lowers his head in grief.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: '...It must be tough to handle all of these.', 4: '1', 18: '100002531'}
{3: 'While Noan is not that close to you, he has happened to witness your most exhausted moment and accepted the lazy side of you.'}
{3: 'He has always kept them a secret, never mocking you or joking about them.'}
{3: 'When you ask him, he always says—'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory262.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noan', 3: "As long as one's alive, it's impossible to be indifferent to everything. Everybody has some moments they feel depressed and want to escape.", 4: '1', 18: '100002532'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory785.jpg'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory782.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '0.2', 5: '0'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Sometimes, you wonder—what does he think of you, when he hears others call you a "hero"?'}
{2: 'Noan, what kind of person do you think I am?', 3: '78'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Huh? Why the sudden question?', 4: '1', 18: '100002533'}
{2: '(Roughly explain to him)', 3: '80'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Just like what everyone else sees you—humanity's hero, a shining hope, the invincible Gray Raven Commandant... I guess?", 4: '1', 18: '100002534'}
{2: 'What else?', 3: '82', 4: 'You are more than "everyone else."', 5: '82'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'You found me at a crossroads... always willing to believe in me, always standing by my side.', 4: '1', 18: '100002535'}
{2: 'You have said that before.', 3: '84', 4: "You know I'm not just asking about that...", 5: '84'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Alright... before I answer that question, let me tell you a story.', 4: '1', 18: '100002536'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "It is a comic based on the Sleeping Beauty fairy tale. Unlike the traditional tale, the princess in this story wasn't blessed by the fairies.", 4: '1', 18: '100002537'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'All those fairies surrounding her were all humans in disguise, yet everyone else believed she was truly blessed.', 4: '1', 18: '100002538'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'They expected her to grow into a woman who was capable of doing everything. To them, she was a blessed lucky bastard.', 4: '1', 18: '100002539'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'But how could the princess live up to these excessive expectations without the blessing of real fairies?', 4: '1', 18: '100002540'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'She had no choice but to study hard day and night, forsaking all the joys that she should have in life.', 4: '1', 18: '100002541'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Yet, people only admired her for her talent and fortune, taking all her achievements for granted... No one acknowledged her efforts.', 4: '1', 18: '100002542'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'I guess this is how I see you. So, my answer is "you are more than what they see."', 4: '1', 18: '100002543'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "You are more than humanity's hero, their hope, and the invincible commandant. To me, you're also more than someone who believes in me and stands by my side.", 4: '1', 18: '100002544'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "To me, you're more like... a person. A person who can feel hurt, tired, and sad.", 4: '1', 18: '100002545'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'A person who keeps fighting for people and things they love even if they are covered in scars.', 4: '1', 18: '100002546'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "And I like such a person... It is those weaknesses that make you more real. It also means that I'm trusted by you, right?", 4: '1', 18: '100002547'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Be it Constructs or humans, everyone has moments when they're overwhelmed by pain, wanting to cry, or wanting to give up.", 4: '1', 18: '100002548'}
{2: "But tears can't save anyone.", 3: '102', 4: 'Yeah. Who can possibly be strong enough to ignore those feelings?', 5: '106'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Yeah. My mother once said the same to me. I didn't know how to respond back then.", 4: '1', 18: '100002549'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'If I could go back in time, I would definitely tell her, "But tears can save myself."', 4: '1', 18: '100002550'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Even heroes in stories have their regrets, let alone us mortals. Don't be too hard on yourself, Commandant.", 4: '1', 18: '100002551'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Yeah. Sunflowers lower their heads at night, not because they are weak. It is just proof that they have not withered inside.', 4: '1', 18: '100002552'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "When you're feeling down, you can always come to me.", 4: '1', 18: '100002553'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "And then we'll run away together... to a place where we can rest and cry our hearts out.", 4: '1', 18: '100002554'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "I'll stay by your side until you feel better.", 4: '1', 18: '100002555'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'Mm...', 3: '117', 4: "What's the ending of that Sleeping Beauty story?", 5: '112'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'The "prince" in the story finally woke up the princess from a hundred-year sleep in the castle, allowing time to flow again.', 4: '1', 18: '100002556'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: '...Which made her time rapidly catch up to the "present" moment. She died in his arms.', 4: '1', 18: '100002557'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Their timelines didn't align, but we can still cherish the present.", 4: '1', 18: '100002558'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'Still, it often comes to me that...', 3: '118'}
{2: 'There are still many people who struggle to barely survive.', 3: '119'}
{2: 'My troubles are nothing compared to theirs.', 3: '120'}
{2: 'I should at least try to do something with the time I spend worrying.', 3: '121'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Are you saying that we are only allowed to be sad when we are deeply hurt?', 4: '1', 18: '100002559'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Even the people in the story living a peaceful, ordinary life had their own troubles.', 4: '1', 18: '100002560'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "People they didn't like, relationships that were hard to maintain, parents who couldn't understand each other, tedious work and chores...", 4: '1', 18: '100002561'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'All these things would slowly wear them off and make them exhausted... Just the ordinary day-to-day life can break people down if nothing good happens.', 4: '1', 18: '100002562'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Isn't it too harsh to check if they have the right to be sad or not?", 4: '1', 18: '100002563'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "But I know that... there are still many things that you care about here, which is why you're reluctant to take a break.", 4: '1', 18: '100002564'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'Yeah. I just want to take one more step forward if possible.', 3: '130'}
{2: "Can't really find a moment to rest amidst this constant hustle.", 3: '131', 4: 'How can I cheer myself up?', 5: '131'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory782.jpg', 3: '0.2', 4: '0.4', 5: '1'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Do you have anything you really like? Food, flowers, stories, or... people?', 4: '1', 18: '100002565'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory782.jpg', 3: '0.4', 4: '0.7', 5: '1'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "When people work hard and don't have the time to rest, they give others the right to heal them. So...", 4: '1', 18: '100002566'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory782.jpg', 3: '0.7', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory782.jpg'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "You should seek help from the people and things you love when you're weary and in pain.", 4: '1', 18: '100002567'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: "Don't worry, I'll go to them.", 3: '143', 4: 'May I come to you?', 5: '147'}
{3: 'He reveals a somewhat lonely smile in the rising sun, then gently nods.'}
{3: 'He still has much to say but decides to hold his emotions behind the gap between you and him until granted permission.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "...The sun's up. Let's go back, Commandant.", 4: '1', 18: '100002569'}
{3: 'Noan stands up. With one step, he closes the gap between you and him, and leans in once more.'}
{3: 'After waiting for an agonizing three seconds and confirming that you would not push him away, he finally holds you tightly.'}
{3: 'In that moment, you feel as if he has sighed in relief.'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "I'm so happy... Really, really happy.", 4: '1', 18: '100002571'}
{3: 'The sunlight pierces through the clouds, casting a soft golden hue over both of you.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: 'The sun has risen...', 3: '155', 4: "It's daytime now.", 5: '155'}
{2: 'Should we head back?', 3: '156'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: "Why don't you stay a little longer? Just find an excuse later when you're back.", 4: '1', 18: '100002572'}
{2: 'Alright.', 3: '158', 4: "That doesn't sound very nice.", 5: '158'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Should we go somewhere farther when the issues of my frame are solved?', 4: '1', 18: '100002573'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'We have a lot of options... I had been to many places when I was a traveling merchant or a cargo captain.', 4: '1', 18: '100002574'}
{2: 'Noan', 3: 'Ruins covered in flowers, bases with burning bonfires, and uncontaminated rivers... There are still many lovely landscapes in this devastated world.', 4: '1', 18: '100002575'}
{2: "It's a deal then.", 3: '163'}
